holidays.name: International Left-Handers Day
holidays.description: A day to celebrate the uniqueness and quirks of being left-handed in a right-handed world! Lefties get recognition for their creativity and the special challenges they face.
holidays.origin: Created by Dean R. Campbell in 1976 to raise awareness of the inconveniences left-handed people encounter.
holidays.funFact: Approximately only 10% of the world's population is left-handed, making this day a rare and special celebration!

holidays.name: World Elephant Day
holidays.description: Dedicated to the preservation and protection of elephants worldwide, raising awareness about their plight and the importance of conservation.
holidays.origin: Founded in 2012 by Patricia Sims and the Elephant Reintroduction Foundation to inspire and educate about elephant conservation.
holidays.funFact: Elephants are known for their incredible memory and complex social structures, making them one of the most intelligent animals on Earth.

holidays.name: Vinyl Record Day
holidays.description: A celebration of all things vinyl, from collecting classic records to appreciating the warm sound unique to analog music formats.
holidays.origin: Emerging from the resurgence of vinyl record popularity among audiophiles and collectors in the 21st century.
holidays.funFact: Vinyl records outsold CDs for the first time since the 1980s in the past decade, proving that old school is cool again!

holidays.name: Middle Child Day
holidays.description: A quirky day to recognize and appreciate middle children who often feel sandwiched between their siblings, sometimes overlooked but definitely special.
holidays.origin: Uncertain, but it gained popularity online as families looked to spotlight different sibling roles.
holidays.funFact: Middle children are often said to be great negotiators and peacemakers within families!
